p: Among triterpenoids, ursolic acid (ULA) is a widespread secondary metabolite found in pomace, cork, flower, sprout, leaf, and the bark of various plants [ 7]. ULA is a natural compound well-known for its wide range of beneficial effects, such as anticancer, anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, antiprotozoan, antioxidant, antidiabetic, and antiviral effects [ 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13]. Ursonic acid (UNA) is a phytochemical which can be also extracted from a great variety of traditional medicinal herbs. Considering that UNA is a triterpenoid which has a molecular structure similar to ULA, it is expected that UNA may demonstrate strong potential to treat human disease as well.
